page.title: 12SOUTHDOWNS RETIREMENT HOMES
page.content: {Southdowns}was opened in 1867 as "The Homes for Little Boys" and was seen as a pioneer scheme of the 'cottage-style' system - with 11 separate houses it was a break away from the institutional type of building, but was eventually closed in 1961.{Southdowns}was reopened in 1978 as another unique scheme of its kind, offering retirement homes in a village style community. At present there are 178 residents of retirement age. Res- idency is available by the purchase of a licence for a capital sum ranging from Â£21-32,000. There are annual service charges of Â£1,600-Â£2,800 which cover rates, estate maintenance, emer- gency call service, domestic and laundry service. Domestic fuel costs are extra. Amenities include a dining hall and bar, bus service and library. There are 2 resident nurses on duty.
